14 // This class solves the graph automorphism problem
15 // (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_automorphism), a variant of the famous
16 // graph isomorphism problem (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_isomorphism).
17 //
18 // The algorithm is largely based on the following article, published in 2008:
19 // "Faster Symmetry Discovery using Sparsity of Symmetries" by Darga, Sakallah
20 // and Markov. http://web.eecs.umich.edu/~imarkov/pubs/conf/dac08-sym.pdf.
21 //
22 // See the comments on the class below for more details.
23 
24 #ifndef OR_TOOLS_ALGORITHMS_FIND_GRAPH_SYMMETRIES_H_
25 #define OR_TOOLS_ALGORITHMS_FIND_GRAPH_SYMMETRIES_H_
26 
27 #include <memory>
28 #include <vector>
29 
30 #include "absl/status/status.h"
31 #include "absl/time/time.h"
32 #include "ortools/algorithms/dynamic_partition.h"
33 #include "ortools/algorithms/dynamic_permutation.h"
34 #include "ortools/graph/graph.h"
35 #include "ortools/graph/iterators.h"
36 #include "ortools/util/stats.h"
37 #include "ortools/util/time_limit.h"

39 namespace operations_research {
40 
41 class SparsePermutation;
42 
43 class GraphSymmetryFinder {
44  public:
45  typedef ::util::StaticGraph<> Graph;
46 
47  // If the Graph passed to the GraphSymmetryFinder is undirected, i.e.
48  // for every arc a->b, b->a is also present, then you should set
49  // "is_undirected" to true.
50  // This will, in effect, DCHECK() that the graph is indeed undirected,
51  // and bypass the need for reverse adjacency lists.
52  //
53  // If you don't know this in advance, you may use GraphIsSymmetric() from
54  // ortools/graph/util.h.
55  //
56  // "graph" must not have multi-arcs.
57  // TODO(user): support multi-arcs.
58  GraphSymmetryFinder(const Graph& graph, bool is_undirected);
59 
60  // Whether the given permutation is an automorphism of the graph given at
61  // construction. This costs O(sum(degree(x))) (the sum is over all nodes x
62  // that are displaced by the permutation).
63  bool IsGraphAutomorphism(const DynamicPermutation& permutation) const;
64 
65  // Find a set of generators of the automorphism subgroup of the graph that
66  // respects the given node equivalence classes. The generators are themselves
67  // permutations of the nodes: see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automorphism.
68  // These permutations may only map a node onto a node of its equivalence
69  // class: two nodes i and j are in the same equivalence class iff
70  // node_equivalence_classes_io[i] == node_equivalence_classes_io[j];
71  //
72  // This set of generators is not necessarily the smallest possible (neither in
73  // the number of generators, nor in the size of these generators), but it is
74  // minimal in that no generator can be removed while keeping the generated
75  // group intact.
76  // TODO(user): verify the minimality in unit tests.
77  //
78  // Note that if "generators" is empty, then the graph has no symmetry: the
79  // only automorphism is the identity.
80  //
81  // The equivalence classes are actually an input/output: they are refined
82  // according to all asymmetries found. In the end, n1 and n2 will be
83  // considered equivalent (i.e. node_equivalence_classes_io[n1] ==
84  // node_equivalence_classes_io[n2]) if and only if there exists a
85  // permutation of nodes that:
86  // - keeps the graph invariant
87  // - maps n1 onto n2
88  // - maps each node to a node of its original equivalence class.
89  //
90  // This method also outputs the size of the automorphism group, expressed as
91  // a factorized product of integers (note that the size itself may be as
92  // large as N!).
93  //
94  // DEADLINE AND PARTIAL COMPLETION:
95  // If the deadline passed as argument is reached, this method will return
96  // quickly (within a few milliseconds). The outputs may be partially filled:
97  // - Each element of "generators", if non-empty, will be a valid permutation.
98  // - "node_equivalence_classes_io" will contain the equivalence classes
99  // corresponding to the orbits under all the generators in "generators".
100  // - "factorized_automorphism_group_size" will also be incomplete, and
101  // partially valid: its last element may be undervalued. But all prior
102  // elements are valid factors of the automorphism group size.
103  absl::Status FindSymmetries(
104  double time_limit_seconds, std::vector<int>* node_equivalence_classes_io,
105  std::vector<std::unique_ptr<SparsePermutation> >* generators,
106  std::vector<int>* factorized_automorphism_group_size);
107 
108  // Fully refine the partition of nodes, using the graph as symmetry breaker.
109  // This means applying the following steps on each part P of the partition:
110  // - Compute the aggregated in-degree of all nodes of the graph, only looking
111  // at arcs originating from nodes in P.
112  // - For each in-degree d=1...max_in_degree, refine the partition by the set
113  // of nodes with in-degree d.
114  // And recursively applying it on all new or modified parts.
115  //
116  // In our use cases, we may call this in a scenario where the partition was
117  // already partially refined on all parts #0...#K, then you should set
118  // "first_unrefined_part_index" to K+1.
119  void RecursivelyRefinePartitionByAdjacency(int first_unrefined_part_index,
120  DynamicPartition* partition);
121 
122  // **** Methods below are public FOR TESTING ONLY. ****
123 
124  // Special wrapper of the above method: assuming that partition is already
125  // fully refined, further refine it by {node}, and propagate by adjacency.
126  // Also, optionally collect all the new singletons of the partition in
127  // "new_singletons", sorted by their part number in the partition.
128  void DistinguishNodeInPartition(int node, DynamicPartition* partition,
129  std::vector<int>* new_singletons_or_null);
130 
131  private:
132  const Graph& graph_;
133 
134  inline int NumNodes() const { return graph_.num_nodes(); }
135 
136  // If the graph isn't symmetric, then we store the reverse adjacency lists
137  // here: for each i in 0..NumNodes()-1, the list of nodes that have an
138  // outgoing arc to i is stored (sorted by node) in:
139  // flattened_reverse_adj_lists_[reverse_adj_list_index_[i] ...
140  // reverse_adj_list_index_[i + 1]]
141  // and can be iterated on easily with:
142  // for (const int tail : TailsOfIncomingArcsTo(node)) ...
143  //
144  // If the graph was specified as symmetric upon construction, both these
145  // vectors are empty, and TailsOfIncomingArcsTo() crashes.
146  std::vector<int> flattened_reverse_adj_lists_;
147  std::vector<int> reverse_adj_list_index_;
148  util::BeginEndWrapper<std::vector<int>::const_iterator> TailsOfIncomingArcsTo(
149  int node) const;
150 
151  // Deadline management. Populated upon FindSymmetries().
152  mutable std::unique_ptr<TimeLimit> time_limit_;
153 
154  // Internal search code used in FindSymmetries(), split out for readability:
155  // find one permutation (if it exists) that maps root_node to root_image_node
156  // and such that the image of "base_partition" by that permutation is equal to
157  // the "image_partition". If no such permutation exists, returns nullptr.
158  //
159  // "generators_found_so_far" and "permutations_displacing_node" are used for
160  // pruning in the search. The former is just the "generators" vector of
161  // FindGraphSymmetries(), with the permutations found so far; and the latter
162  // is an inverted index from each node to all permutations (that we found)
163  // that displace it.
164  std::unique_ptr<SparsePermutation> FindOneSuitablePermutation(
165  int root_node, int root_image_node, DynamicPartition* base_partition,
166  DynamicPartition* image_partition,
167  const std::vector<std::unique_ptr<SparsePermutation> >&
168  generators_found_so_far,
169  const std::vector<std::vector<int> >& permutations_displacing_node);
170 
171  // Data structure used by FindOneSuitablePermutation(). See the .cc
172  struct SearchState {
173  int base_node;
174 
175  // We're tentatively mapping "base_node" to some image node. At first, we
176  // just pick a single candidate: we fill "first_image_node". If this
177  // candidate doesn't work out, we'll select all other candidates in the same
178  // image part, prune them by the symmetries we found already, and put them
179  // in "remaining_pruned_image_nodes" (and set "first_image_node" to -1).
180  int first_image_node;
181  std::vector<int> remaining_pruned_image_nodes;
182 
183  int num_parts_before_trying_to_map_base_node;
184 
185  // Only parts that are at or beyond this index, or their parent parts, may
186  // be mismatching between the base and the image partitions.
187  int min_potential_mismatching_part_index;
188 
189  SearchState(int bn, int in, int np, int mi)
190  : base_node(bn),
191  first_image_node(in),
192  num_parts_before_trying_to_map_base_node(np),
193  min_potential_mismatching_part_index(mi) {}
194 
195  std::string DebugString() const;
196  };
197  std::vector<SearchState> search_states_;
198 
199  // Subroutine of FindOneSuitablePermutation(), split out for modularity:
200  // With the partial candidate mapping given by "base_partition",
201  // "image_partition" and "current_permutation_candidate", determine whether
202  // we have a full match (eg. the permutation is a valid candidate).
203  // If so, simply return true. If not, return false but also fill
204  // "next_base_node" and "next_image_node" with what should be the next mapping
205  // decision.
206  //
207  // This also uses and updates "min_potential_mismatching_part_index_io"
208  // to incrementally search for mismatching parts along the partitions.
209  //
210  // Note(user): there may be false positives, i.e. this method may return true
211  // even if the partitions aren't actually a full match, because it uses
212  // fingerprints to compare part. This should almost never happen.
213  bool ConfirmFullMatchOrFindNextMappingDecision(
214  const DynamicPartition& base_partition,
215  const DynamicPartition& image_partition,
216  const DynamicPermutation& current_permutation_candidate,
217  int* min_potential_mismatching_part_index_io, int* next_base_node,
218  int* next_image_node) const;
219 
220  // Subroutine of FindOneSuitablePermutation(), split out for modularity:
221  // Keep only one node of "nodes" per orbit, where the orbits are described
222  // by a subset of "all_permutations": the ones with indices in
223  // "permutation_indices" and that are compatible with "partition".
224  // For each orbit, keep the first node that appears in "nodes".
225  void PruneOrbitsUnderPermutationsCompatibleWithPartition(
226  const DynamicPartition& partition,
227  const std::vector<std::unique_ptr<SparsePermutation> >& all_permutations,
228  const std::vector<int>& permutation_indices, std::vector<int>* nodes);
229 
230  // Temporary objects used by some of the class methods, and owned by the
231  // class to avoid (costly) re-allocation. Their resting states are described
232  // in the side comments; with N = NumNodes().
233  DynamicPermutation tmp_dynamic_permutation_; // Identity(N)
234  mutable std::vector<bool> tmp_node_mask_; // [0..N-1] = false
235  std::vector<int> tmp_degree_; // [0..N-1] = 0.
236  std::vector<int> tmp_stack_; // Empty.
237  std::vector<std::vector<int> > tmp_nodes_with_degree_; // [0..N-1] = [].
238  MergingPartition tmp_partition_; // Reset(N).
239  std::vector<const SparsePermutation*> tmp_compatible_permutations_; // Empty.
240 
241  // Internal statistics, used for performance tuning and debugging.
242  struct Stats : public StatsGroup {
243  Stats()
244  : StatsGroup("GraphSymmetryFinder"),
245  initialization_time("a Initialization", this),
246  initialization_refine_time("b ┗╸Refine", this),
247  invariant_dive_time("c Invariant Dive", this),
248  main_search_time("d Main Search", this),
249  invariant_unroll_time("e ┣╸Dive unroll", this),
250  permutation_output_time("f ┣╸Permutation output", this),
251  search_time("g ┗╸FindOneSuitablePermutation()", this),
252  search_time_fail("h ┣╸Fail", this),
253  search_time_success("i ┣╸Success", this),
254  initial_search_refine_time("j ┣╸Initial refine", this),
255  search_refine_time("k ┣╸Further refines", this),
256  quick_compatibility_time("l ┣╸Compatibility checks", this),
257  quick_compatibility_fail_time("m ┃ ┣╸Fail", this),
258  quick_compatibility_success_time("n ┃ ┗╸Success", this),
259  dynamic_permutation_refinement_time(
260  "o ┣╸Dynamic permutation refinement", this),
261  map_election_std_time(
262  "p ┣╸Mapping election / full match detection", this),
263  map_election_std_mapping_time("q ┃ ┣╸Mapping elected", this),
264  map_election_std_full_match_time("r ┃ ┗╸Full Match", this),
265  automorphism_test_time("s ┣╸[Upon full match] Automorphism check",
266  this),
267  automorphism_test_fail_time("t ┃ ┣╸Fail", this),
268  automorphism_test_success_time("u ┃ ┗╸Success", this),
269  search_finalize_time("v ┣╸[Upon auto success] Finalization", this),
270  dynamic_permutation_undo_time(
271  "w ┣╸[Upon auto fail, full] Dynamic permutation undo", this),
272  map_reelection_time(
273  "x ┣╸[Upon auto fail, partial] Mapping re-election", this),
274  non_singleton_search_time("y ┃ ┗╸Non-singleton search", this),
275  backtracking_time("z ┗╸Backtracking", this),
276  pruning_time("{ ┗╸Pruning", this),
277  search_depth("~ Search Stats: search_depth", this) {}
278

280  TimeDistribution initialization_refine_time;
281  TimeDistribution invariant_dive_time;
282  TimeDistribution main_search_time;

308  };
309  mutable Stats stats_;
310 };
